reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that guarantees a minimum payment under specific circumstances (call-out, no work). It's classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME because it results in hours being paid and assigned to an overtime bucket.

name: Call Out Minimum Pay - Work Commenced
rule_text: Employees who are called in and commence work shall be paid for a minimum of three (3) hours at the applicable overtime rate and any travel and transportation applicable.
summary: An employee who is called out after their shift and starts working is guaranteed a minimum of 3 hours of pay at the overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type == 'EMERGENCY_CALLOUT' AND call_out_work_commenced (llm) == true -> VALIDATE(MINIMUM(OT, 3))

expected_outcome.condition: A minimum of 3 hours must be paid for a call out where work was commenced.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that guarantees a minimum payment when a call-out results in work being performed. It is classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it dictates the minimum hours to be paid into an overtime bucket.

name: Call Out Pay for Actual Hours Worked Over Minimum
rule_text: Where an Employee works more than the three (3) hours set out in 18.01 (b) above, the Employee shall receive remuneration for the hours actually worked at the applicable overtime rates and any travel or transportation applicable.
summary: If an employee on a call out works for more than the 3-hour minimum, they are paid for all hours they actually worked at the overtime rate, instead of the minimum.
depends_on: Call Out Minimum Pay - Work Commenced
overrides: Call Out Minimum Pay - Work Commenced
logical_representation: IF overtime_type == 'EMERGENCY_CALLOUT' AND call_out_hours_worked (llm) > 3 -> ASSIGN(OT, call_out_hours_worked (llm)) AND OVERRIDE('Call Out Minimum Pay - Work Commenced')

expected_outcome.condition: Hours worked on a call out are paid as OT. If hours exceed 3, actual hours are paid, overriding the 3-hour minimum guarantee.

reasoning: This rule is an exception_override because it explicitly modifies the behavior of the 3-hour minimum rule (18.01 b) when the condition (working more than 3 hours) is met. It ensures employees are paid for their actual work time when it is more beneficial.

name: Insufficient Rest Period After Call Out
rule_text: In the event that an Employee, responding to a call out does not get an eight (8) hour break, prior to the commencement of their regular workday, the Employee(s) shall be allowed an eight (8) hour rest break and be paid for a normally scheduled workday. To qualify for the normally scheduled days pay the Employee shall be available for work at the end of the eight (8) hour break.
summary: If a call out prevents an employee from getting an 8-hour break before their next regular shift, they are given an 8-hour rest break and are still paid for their normal shift, provided they are available to work after the break.
logical_representation: IF hours_between_shifts (llm) < 8 AND is_available_for_work (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, normal_scheduled_workday_hours (llm))

expected_outcome.condition: Employee is paid for their normal shift if their rest period after a call-out was less than 8 hours and they were available for work after the mandated 8-hour rest.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that grants a significant entitlement (paid day off for rest) based on the condition of an insufficient break between a call-out and a regular shift. It is classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it results in straight time hours being paid for a day.

name: Shift Work Minimum Duration
rule_text: when shift work is performed at least two (2) full shifts must be worked in any twenty-four (24) hour period and each of these shifts must continue for at least five (5) consecutive regular working days, or four (4) consecutive regular working days where the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is being utilized.
summary: To qualify as official 'shift work', there must be at least two shifts in a 24-hour period, and each shift must run for a minimum of 5 consecutive days on an 8-hour schedule, or 4 consecutive days on a 10-hour schedule.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND shift_consecutive_days >= 5 -> SET is_shift_work (llm) = true; IF schedule_type starts with '4x10' AND shift_consecutive_days >= 4 -> SET is_shift_work (llm) = true

expected_outcome.condition: Validates if the run of consecutive shift days meets the minimum requirement for the given schedule.

reasoning: This rule defines the conditions that must be met for a work pattern to be considered 'shift work'. It is a foundational definition upon which other rules, like penalties, depend.

name: Penalty for Short Duration Shift
rule_text: Should each of the shifts outlined above not continue for a period of four (4) or five (5) consecutive working days, all hours worked shall be deemed overtime and paid at the applicable rates contained in this Agreement.
summary: If a shift work arrangement does not meet the minimum requirement of 4 or 5 consecutive days, all hours worked during that period must be paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_shift_work (llm) == false AND is_mutually_agreed_short_shift (llm) == false -> ASSIGN(OT, ALL)

expected_outcome.condition: When a shift work period is shorter than the minimum required days and not subject to a mutual agreement.

reasoning: This rule is a penalty that overrides standard straight time calculations when the conditions for a valid shift are not met. It is classified as an exception_override because it changes the time bucket for all hours under a specific negative condition.

name: Short Duration Shift by Mutual Agreement
rule_text: By mutual agreement, shifts may be established for periods of less than four (4) or five (5) consecutive regular working days and in such an event, the deemed overtime that would otherwise be payable shall not apply.
summary: The overtime penalty for short-duration shifts is waived if the shorter shift schedule was mutually agreed upon in advance.
logical_representation: IF is_mutually_agreed_short_shift (llm) == true -> OVERRIDE('Penalty for Short Duration Shift')

expected_outcome.condition: When this rule is active, it prevents the 'Penalty for Short Duration Shift' rule from converting all hours to OT.

reasoning: This is a direct override of the penalty rule. It provides a specific condition (mutual agreement) under which another rule's consequences are nullified. Therefore, it's classified as an exception_override.

name: First Shift Daily Overtime (8-hour schedule)
rule_text: The first shift shall work a normal shift as set out in Clause 16.01 and/or 17.01 of this Agreement, with the applicable overtime rate after eight (8) hours of work...
summary: For the first (day) shift on a standard 8-hour workday schedule, overtime begins after 8 hours of work.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'DAY' AND schedule_type == '5x8' -> THRESHOLD(ST, 8) AND AFTER(8, OT)

expected_outcome.condition: Hours worked beyond 8 on a standard first shift workday.

reasoning: This rule establishes a clear numerical threshold for when straight time ends and overtime begins for a specific schedule type, making it a classic 'threshold_based' rule.

name: First Shift Daily Overtime (10-hour schedule)
rule_text: ...with the applicable overtime rate after eight (8) hours of work or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week.
summary: For the first (day) shift on a compressed work week (e.g., 4x10), overtime begins after 10 hours of work.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'DAY' AND schedule_type starts with '4x10' -> THRESHOLD(ST, 10) AND AFTER(10, OT)

expected_outcome.condition: Hours worked beyond 10 on a compressed work week first shift.

reasoning: This rule establishes a clear numerical threshold for a compressed work week schedule, making it a 'threshold_based' rule, distinct from the 8-hour day rule.

name: Alternate Shift Definition
rule_text: Shift work other than the normal shift as outlined in Clause 19.03 may be utilized provided such shift(s) commence between 3.00 PM and 6.00 AM.
summary: An alternate shift (e.g., afternoon or night shift) is defined as any shift that is not the normal day shift and starts between 3:00 PM and 6:00 AM.
logical_representation: IF shift_start_time (llm) >= '15:00' OR shift_start_time (llm) <= '06:00' -> SET shift_type = 'NIGHT'

expected_outcome.condition: Identifies if a worked shift qualifies as an 'alternate shift' based on its start time.

reasoning: This rule defines what constitutes an 'alternate shift' based on start times. It is a definitional rule that serves as a condition for other rules, like shift premiums.

name: Alternate Shift Premium (Effective 2025-05-04)
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be $4.00 per hour effective May 4 th , 2025 ... greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Starting May 4, 2025, employees working on an alternate shift receive a premium of $4.00 per hour on top of their regular rate.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'NIGHT' AND validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND validity_end_date < '2026-05-03' -> ADD_PREMIUM($4.00)

expected_outcome.condition: A $4.00/hr premium should be applied to hours worked on a valid alternate shift within the effective date range.

reasoning: This rule grants a monetary entitlement (a premium) based on a specific condition (working an alternate shift) and an effective date. It's classified as condition_based because it's not tied to an hour threshold but to the type of shift worked.

name: Alternate Shift Premium (Effective 2026-05-03)
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be ... ($4.50 effective May 3, 2026) greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Starting May 3, 2026, the premium for employees working on an alternate shift increases to $4.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'NIGHT' AND validity_start_date >= '2026-05-03' -> ADD_PREMIUM($4.50)

expected_outcome.condition: A $4.50/hr premium should be applied to hours worked on a valid alternate shift on or after May 3, 2026.

reasoning: Similar to the 2025 premium rule, this is a condition_based entitlement rule, but with a different effective date and amount, requiring a separate rule definition.

name: One Straight Time Shift per 24-Hour Period
rule_text: No Employee shall work more than one (1) straight time shift in each consecutive twenty-four (24) hour period.
summary: An employee can only have one shift paid at straight time within any 24-hour period. Any subsequent work within that period is paid at overtime rates.
logical_representation: IF is_second_shift_in_24_hours (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(OT, ALL)

expected_outcome.condition: All hours worked on a second shift that starts within 24 hours of the previous shift's start time.

reasoning: This rule enforces a condition (only one ST shift per 24h) that alters the pay category of hours worked. It's 'condition_based' as it depends on the timing relative to a previous shift, not on the number of hours worked in a single day.

name: Overtime Continuation for Insufficient Rest Period
rule_text: An Employee shall continue to receive the overtime rate, plus shift differential, after each shift until a break of eight (8) consecutive hours occurs, exclusive of travel allowance.
summary: If an employee does not receive a break of at least 8 consecutive hours between shifts, the hours worked on the subsequent shift continue to be paid at the overtime rate until such a break is taken.
logical_representation: IF hours_since_last_shift (llm) < 8 -> ASSIGN(OT, ALL)

expected_outcome.condition: All hours of a shift that begins less than 8 hours after the previous shift ended.

reasoning: This rule is 'condition_based' because it triggers a change in hour classification based on the condition of an insufficient rest period, overriding normal straight-time rules.

name: Single Shift at Variance - Shift Differential Entitlement
rule_text: Where the owner/client may require work to be done on a single shift basis at start/quit times that may be at variance with the start/quit for a regular shift, single shift operations shall be permitted subject to the payment of shift differential. The shift differential shall be paid on all hours worked.
summary: If a single shift is required to run at non-standard start/end times, a shift differential must be paid on all hours worked during that shift.
logical_representation: IF is_single_shift_at_variance (llm) == true -> ADD_PREMIUM(shift_differential_amount)

expected_outcome.condition: A shift differential premium should be applied to all hours worked on a single shift operating at non-standard times.

reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement to a premium payment based on the specific condition of working a 'single shift at variance'. It is classified as condition_based.

name: Single Shift at Variance - Daily OT (8-hr Day)
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day...
summary: For single shifts at non-standard times on a regular 8-hour/day schedule, overtime applies to all hours worked after 8 in a day.
logical_representation: IF is_single_shift_at_variance (llm) == true AND schedule_type == '5x8' -> THRESHOLD(ST, 8) AND AFTER(8, OT)

expected_outcome.condition: Hours worked beyond 8 on a single shift at variance on an 8-hour schedule.

reasoning: This rule sets a specific daily hour threshold for overtime under the condition of a 'single shift at variance', making it a threshold_based rule.

name: Single Shift at Variance - Daily OT (10-hr Day)
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours... in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week...
summary: For single shifts at non-standard times on a compressed work week schedule, overtime applies to all hours worked after 10 in a day.
logical_representation: IF is_single_shift_at_variance (llm) == true AND schedule_type starts with '4x10' -> THRESHOLD(ST, 10) AND AFTER(10, OT)

expected_outcome.condition: Hours worked beyond 10 on a single shift at variance on a compressed work week schedule.

reasoning: This rule sets a specific daily hour threshold for overtime for a compressed work week under the condition of a 'single shift at variance', making it a threshold_based rule.

name: Single Shift at Variance - Weekly Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours... in excess of forty (40) hours per week...
summary: For single shifts at non-standard times, overtime applies to all hours worked after 40 in a week, in addition to daily overtime rules.
logical_representation: IF is_single_shift_at_variance (llm) == true AND weekly_hours > 40 -> TRANSITION(OT)

expected_outcome.condition: Straight time hours become overtime once the 40-hour weekly threshold is passed.

reasoning: This rule establishes a weekly hour threshold that triggers overtime, making it a threshold_based rule.

name: Single Shift at Variance - Weekend and Holiday OT
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours ... on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For single shifts operating at non-standard times, all hours worked on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays are paid as overtime.
overrides: Single Shift at Variance - Daily OT (8-hr Day)
Single Shift at Variance - Daily OT (10-hr Day)
logical_representation: IF is_single_shift_at_variance (llm) == true AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> ASSIGN(OT, ALL)

expected_outcome.condition: All hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or Statutory Holiday during a single shift at variance operation.

reasoning: This rule applies to entire days (Saturday, Sunday, Holiday) and dictates that all hours on those days are categorized as overtime. This is characteristic of a day_based rule.

name: Minimum Show Up Pay (2 Hours)
rule_text: When an Employee reports to work at the regular starting time and such Employee is not put to work,  the  Employee  so  affected  shall  be  entitled  to  a  minimum  of  two  (2)  hours  pay  at  the applicable rate of pay.
summary: An employee who reports for their regular shift but is not put to work is guaranteed a minimum of 2 hours of pay at the rate applicable for that day (e.g., straight time, overtime, or double time).
logical_representation: IF reported_to_work (llm) == true AND is_put_to_work (llm) == false -> PAY_MINIMUM(2, applicable_rate)

expected_outcome.condition: Employee reports to work but is not given work, a minimum of 2 hours must be paid.

reasoning: This rule establishes a conditional minimum payment, not a rate change based on hours worked. Therefore, it is classified as 'condition_based' under 'LABOR_WORKED_TIME'.

name: Show Up Time Qualification (Remain on Site)
rule_text: In  order  to  qualify  for  show  up  time,  Employees  must  remain  on  the  jobsite  unless  otherwise directed by the Employer.
summary: To be eligible for show-up pay, an employee must remain on the job site unless specifically told they can leave by the employer.
logical_representation: REQUIRE(remains_on_jobsite (llm) == true) FOR 'Minimum Show Up Pay (2 Hours)'

expected_outcome.condition: This rule acts as a prerequisite; if the employee leaves the site without permission, show-up pay is void.

reasoning: This rule is a prerequisite condition for another entitlement ('Minimum Show Up Pay'). It does not define hours or pay itself, making it 'condition_based'.

name: Pay for Waiting on Site Beyond 2 Hours
rule_text: Where the Employee(s) are directed to remain at the jobsite for more than two (2) hours, including wait times for company supplied transportation to leave site, they shall be paid for such time at the applicable rate.
summary: If an employee is directed to wait on the job site for more than two hours (including waiting for transport), they must be paid for the entire duration of the wait time at the applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF is_directed_to_remain_on_site (llm) == true AND wait_time_hours (llm) > 2 -> PAY(wait_time_hours (llm), applicable_rate)

expected_outcome.condition: The entire waiting time is paid if the directed wait exceeds 2 hours.

reasoning: This rule triggers a payment entitlement based on a time threshold ('more than two (2) hours'), making it 'threshold_based'.

name: Show Up Pay Invalidation (2-Hour Notice)
rule_text: An Employee is not entitled to show up time if the Employer notifies the Employee that no work is available at least two (2) hours prior to the commencement of the normal workday.
summary: An employee is not eligible for show-up pay if the employer provides notice of no work at least 2 hours before the regular shift start time.
logical_representation: IF work_cancellation_notice_hours (llm) >= 2 -> OVERRIDE('Minimum Show Up Pay (2 Hours)')

expected_outcome.condition: If sufficient notice is given, the 2-hour minimum show-up pay is not applicable.

reasoning: This rule explicitly negates another entitlement under specific circumstances, making it a classic 'exception_override'.

name: Show Up Pay Invalidation (Camp Workers)
rule_text: Employees working on a jobsite where they are accommodated in a camp facility will not be entitled to show up time if they are notified that no work is available, at breakfast time, and notices are posted on the bulletin boards in the camp kitchen.
summary: Camp-based employees are not eligible for show-up pay if they are notified of no work by breakfast time through a posted notice in the camp kitchen.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_provided == true AND is_notified_at_breakfast (llm) == true AND is_notice_posted (llm) == true -> OVERRIDE('Minimum Show Up Pay (2 Hours)')

expected_outcome.condition: If a camp worker is properly notified at breakfast, the 2-hour minimum show-up pay is not applicable.

reasoning: This rule provides a specific set of conditions for a particular group (camp workers) that overrides the general show-up pay rule, classifying it as an 'exception_override'.

name: Shift Premium on Show Up Pay
rule_text: When an Employee reporting for work qualifies for show up time such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
summary: If an employee receives show-up pay, that pay must also include any shift premium they would have normally received for the shift.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_show_up_pay (llm) == true AND has_shift_premium (llm) == true -> APPLY_SHIFT_PREMIUM()

expected_outcome.condition: Show-up pay calculation is modified to include shift premium if applicable.

reasoning: This rule adds a component to a pay calculation based on a specific condition (qualifying for show-up time), making it 'condition_based'. It modifies the final pay amount.

name: Industrial Foreman Premium
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $5.50 per hour above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, a Foreman must be paid a premium of at least $5.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman wage rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_foreman == true -> APPLY_RATE_PREMIUM($5.50/hr)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that the Foreman's hourly rate includes a premium of at least $5.50 over the Journeyman base rate.

reasoning: This rule defines a conditional wage premium based on the employee's role (Foreman) and project type (Industrial). It's classified as 'condition_based' under 'LABOR_WORKED_TIME' as it directly affects the pay rate calculation.

name: Industrial General Foreman Premium
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $7.50 per hour, above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, a General Foreman must be paid a premium of at least $7.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman wage rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true -> APPLY_RATE_PREMIUM($7.50/hr)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that the General Foreman's hourly rate includes a premium of at least $7.50 over the Journeyman base rate.

reasoning: This rule defines a conditional wage premium based on the employee's role (General Foreman) and project type (Industrial). It's classified as 'condition_based' under 'LABOR_WORKED_TIME' as it directly affects the pay rate calculation.

name: Industrial ICCS Premium
rule_text: Foremen and General Foremen who are Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designated will be paid additional premiums of one ($1.50) dollar and fifty cents per hour.
summary: On Industrial projects, Foremen and General Foremen with an ICCS designation receive an additional premium of $1.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND (is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) AND has_iccs_designation (llm) == true -> APPLY_RATE_PREMIUM($1.50/hr)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that an ICCS-designated supervisor receives an additional $1.50/hr premium.

reasoning: This rule specifies an additional premium based on a specific certification (ICCS) for supervisors on Industrial projects. It's a 'condition_based' rule affecting pay calculations.

name: Industrial Apprentice Cannot Be Foreman
rule_text: Apprentices shall not be elevated to the position of Foremen or be authorized to direct any portion of the working force.
summary: On Industrial projects, an Apprentice cannot be assigned the role of Foreman.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> VALIDATE(is_foreman == false)

expected_outcome.condition: An Apprentice cannot be a Foreman. This combination is invalid and should be flagged.

reasoning: This rule is a constraint on role assignment based on employee class. It is classified as 'LABOR_WORKED_TIME' because it prevents an apprentice from being paid as a foreman, thus it's a validation rule for the payroll system. It's 'condition_based' on the employee's class.

name: Industrial Second Foreman Requirement
rule_text: The Employer agrees that there shall be two (2) Foremen once there are fourteen (14) Journeymen on the job.
summary: On Industrial projects, if there are 14 or more Journeymen on a job, there must be at least two Foremen.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND journeyman_count (llm) >= 14 -> VALIDATE(foreman_count (llm) >= 2)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that the number of Foremen is at least 2 when Journeymen count is 14 or more.

reasoning: This is a crew composition rule that is triggered by a specific threshold of journeymen. It is a 'threshold_based' rule for validating the crew sheet against contract requirements.

name: Industrial Welder Foreman Requirement at 15 Welders
rule_text: On projects requiring a minimum of fifteen (15) Welders; there shall be a Qualified 'A' or 'B' Welder employed as a Welder Foreman when fifteen (15) welders are employed.
summary: On Industrial projects, once 15 welders are employed, there must be at least one Welder Foreman.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 15 -> VALIDATE(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 1)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that at least one Welder Foreman is present when welder count is 15 or more.

reasoning: This crew composition rule is triggered by a specific threshold of welders. It is a 'threshold_based' rule for validating correct supervisory staffing.

name: Industrial Second Welder Foreman Requirement at 25 Welders
rule_text: An additional Welder Foreman will be employed when twenty-five (25) welders are employed
summary: On Industrial projects, once 25 welders are employed, a second Welder Foreman must be added (for a total of at least two).
depends_on: Industrial Welder Foreman Requirement at 15 Welders
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 25 -> VALIDATE(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2)

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that at least two Welder Foremen are present when welder count is 25 or more.

reasoning: This is the next tier of the Welder Foreman crew composition rule, triggered by a higher threshold of welders. It is 'threshold_based'.

name: Industrial Subsequent Welder Foreman Requirement
rule_text: and  one  (1)  Welder  Foreman  for  every  twenty  (20)  Welders  employed  thereafter.
summary: On Industrial projects, after the initial 25 welders, one additional Welder Foreman is required for every subsequent group of 20 welders.
depends_on: Industrial Second Welder Foreman Requirement at 25 Welders
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) > 25 -> VALIDATE(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2 + FLOOR((welder_count (llm) - 25) / 20))

expected_outcome.condition: Validate that the number of Welder Foremen scales correctly for every 20 welders after the first 25.

reasoning: This rule defines a recurring, scaling requirement for supervisory staff based on a 'threshold_based' calculation, making it a crew composition validation rule.

name: C/I Foreman Premium (Local 488)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.

expected_outcome.condition: For Local 488 on C/I projects, validate the Foreman's rate includes a $4.00 premium.

reasoning: This rule defines a conditional wage premium. It is 'condition_based' because it depends on project type, employee role, and a specific Union Local.

summary: On Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 496, a Foreman must be paid a premium of at least $3.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.

name: C/I General Foreman Premium (Local 496)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement

name: Paid Bus Transit Time In Excess of 45 Minutes
rule_text: Workers shall be paid an allowance for time regularly and routinely in excess of forty five minutes each way, for travel within the applicable free zone.  The allowance shall be calculated on the regular straight time base rate of each worker.  The allowance will be paid only to workers who ride on the provided buses, and only for the days on which they ride the buses.
summary: Employees who use employer-provided buses for transit between the site and camp (or other designated points) are paid at their straight-time rate for any travel time that exceeds 45 minutes each way. This applies only on days they use the bus.
logical_representation: IF uses_provided_bus (llm) == true AND travel_time_one_way_minutes (llm) > 45 -> ASSIGN(ST, ((travel_time_one_way_minutes (llm) - 45) * 2) / 60)

expected_outcome.condition: When bus travel time exceeds 45 minutes each way, the excess time is paid as ST.

reasoning: This rule establishes a specific condition (bus travel time > 45 mins) that triggers a payment of hours at a specific rate (ST). It is threshold-based because the entitlement begins only after the 45-minute threshold is crossed.

name: Industrial Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometer (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required, the Employer will have the following options;  to provide transportation and pay travel allowance, or  reimburse the Employees, as a vehicle allowance... and pay travel allowance. The  travel  allowance  shall  be  calculated  based  on  traveling  at  80  km  per  hour,  at  the Employee's applicable base rate, from the point where the edge of the 45 km radius free zone intersects the road which takes the shortest, most appropriate route, to the project and return to the intersecting point.
summary: For daily travel to Industrial projects beyond the 45km free zone, employees receive a travel allowance paid as time. This time is calculated based on the round-trip distance from the free zone edge to the site, assuming a speed of 80 km/hr, and is paid at the employee's straight-time base rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_daily_commute_beyond_free_zone (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, (distance_from_free_zone_km (llm) * 2) / 80)

expected_outcome.condition: For daily travel to an Industrial project outside the 45km free zone.

reasoning: This rule defines an entitlement to paid travel time based on the condition that the project is Industrial and located beyond the free zone. The calculation is based on a formula, not hours worked, making it condition-based.

name: Commercial/Institutional Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometre (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required,  then  the  Employer  will  provide  transportation,  plus  a  travel  allowance  to  be negotiated in consultation with the Union, however, in the event no Agreement is reached with the Union then a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers' Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For daily travel to Commercial or Institutional projects beyond the 45km free zone, the employer must provide transportation and a travel allowance. The amount of the allowance is to be negotiated.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND is_daily_commute_beyond_free_zone (llm) == true -> ENTITLEMENT(NEGOTIATED_TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE_HOURS)

expected_outcome.condition: For daily travel to a C/I project outside the 45km free zone. The amount is negotiated and must be entered manually.

reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement based on project type and location. Since the amount of time/pay is negotiated rather than formulaic, it's a condition-based rule that flags an entitlement exists but cannot be automatically calculated by the system without further input.

name: Paid Waiting Time for Delayed Employer Transport
rule_text: When the transportation provided by the Employer for the conveyance of Employees is delayed by circumstances that are reasonably within the control of the Employer or the bussing company, the Employees shall be paid for all such time, providing the delay is in excess of 15 minutes, beyond the scheduled arrival time, up to a limit of two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate.
summary: If employer-provided transportation is delayed by more than 15 minutes beyond its scheduled arrival time due to controllable circumstances, employees must be paid for the delay. Payment is at straight time for up to a maximum of 2 hours.
logical_representation: IF transport_delay_minutes (llm) > 15 -> ASSIGN(ST, MIN(2, transport_delay_minutes (llm) / 60))

expected_outcome.condition: When employer-provided transport is delayed more than 15 minutes.

reasoning: This is a threshold-based rule as the entitlement to be paid for waiting time only begins after a 15-minute delay threshold is met. It defines a minimum condition (delay > 15 mins) and a maximum payment (2 hours).

name: Paid Travel Time Between Jobs During Shift
rule_text: If an Employee is required by the Employer to move from one job to another during working hours, the Employer shall provide the transportation or pay vehicle allowance at the rate established by the formula in 29.02 (a) above per kilometre traveled if the Employee uses their own vehicle. The Employee shall not suffer any loss of pay as a result of transferring between projects during working hours.
summary: When an employee is required to travel between different jobs during their normal working hours, they must be paid for that travel time as if they were working. They cannot lose pay for the time spent transferring.
logical_representation: IF is_travel_between_jobs_during_shift (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, travel_duration_hours (llm))

expected_outcome.condition: When travel occurs between job sites during the employee's regular shift.

reasoning: This rule is condition-based because the entitlement to paid travel time is triggered by the specific condition of being required to move between jobs during a shift. The time is paid at the regular rate, preserving earnings.

name: Overtime Pay for Travel After Shift
rule_text: Employees required to travel out of a city or town to another job after working a shift, and before an eight (8) hour break occurs, shall be paid for all time traveled at the rate of time and one-half the normal rate.
summary: If an employee must travel to another job after completing their shift and without receiving an 8-hour break, all of that travel time is paid at the overtime rate of time and one-half.
logical_representation: IF is_travel_after_shift (llm) == true AND is_break_less_than_8_hours (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(OT, travel_duration_hours (llm))

expected_outcome.condition: When travel to another job occurs after a shift and before an 8-hour break.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule. The entitlement to overtime pay for travel is triggered by two specific conditions: traveling after a shift AND not having an 8-hour break. It assigns all such travel time to the OT bucket.

name: Straight Time Pay for Continued Travel Next Day
rule_text: If still traveling the following day, the Employee shall be paid the normal rate for time traveled during the regular working day only.
summary: If travel to another job extends into the following day, the employee is paid for the travel time at their normal straight-time rate, but only for the hours of travel that fall within their regular working hours.
depends_on: Overtime Pay for Travel After Shift
logical_representation: IF is_continued_travel_from_previous_day (llm) == true AND is_during_regular_hours (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, travel_duration_hours (llm))

expected_outcome.condition: For travel continuing from a previous day, only time traveled during regular working hours is paid as ST.

reasoning: This rule is condition-based, applying only when travel continues to a second day. It sets a specific condition (travel must occur 'during the regular working day') for the time to be paid at the straight-time rate.

name: Paid Time for Relocating Camp Rooms
rule_text: Should an Employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the client's designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rates to carry out the move.
summary: If an employee in camp is required to move their room or to another camp, they are entitled to a payment of two hours at their straight-time rate to compensate for the time and inconvenience of the move.
logical_representation: IF is_required_to_move_rooms (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, 2)

expected_outcome.condition: When an employee is required to move rooms or camps.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that grants a fixed payment of 2 ST hours upon the occurrence of a specific event (being required to move rooms). It is not based on hours worked or a threshold.

name: Travel Allowance from Remote Accommodation
rule_text: When an Employee is being paid subsistence allowance in accordance with Article 29.04 and when there is no suitable accommodation available within 45 km. of the project on which the Employee is engaged, the Employer shall determine the location of the nearest available suitable accommodation and shall determine the number of road kilometers beyond a 45 kilometer radius of the project that would be required to travel each way from the nearest available suitable accommodation, and shall calculate the travel allowance in accordance with those provisions as identified in Article 29.02.
summary: Employees receiving subsistence who cannot find suitable accommodation within 45km of the job site are entitled to a travel allowance. This allowance is for the daily round-trip travel from the nearest available accommodation to the edge of the 45km radius, calculated at a speed of 80 km/hr and paid at straight time.
logical_representation: IF is_receiving_subsistence (Unsupported) == true AND no_accommodation_within_45km (llm) == true -> ASSIGN(ST, (distance_from_45km_radius_km (llm) * 2) / 80)

expected_outcome.condition: When an employee on subsistence must stay more than 45km from the site due to lack of accommodation.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule triggered by two conditions: the employee receives subsistence and suitable accommodation is unavailable within 45km. It provides a formula to calculate paid travel time, similar to the main daily travel rule.

name: Forfeiture of Travel Pay for Work Refusal
rule_text: Employees who are transported to a job site but who refuse to start work at the prescribed time due to a picket line or other form of labour relations dispute will not be paid transportation or travel allowance for that day.
summary: Employees who are transported to the worksite but then refuse to work because of a picket line or other labor dispute forfeit any entitlement to transportation or travel allowance for that day.
overrides: Industrial Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone
Commercial/Institutional Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone
Paid Bus Transit Time In Excess of 45 Minutes
logical_representation: IF refuses_work_due_to_dispute (llm) == true -> OVERRIDE('Industrial Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone', 'Commercial/Institutional Daily Travel Allowance Beyond Free Zone', 'Paid Bus Transit Time In Excess of 45 Minutes')

expected_outcome.condition: When an employee refuses to work due to a labor dispute, any travel pay for that day is nullified.

reasoning: This rule is an exception that explicitly cancels out other entitlements. Therefore, its type is 'exception_override'. It depends on the existence of other travel pay rules and functions to negate them under a specific circumstance.

name: LOU Validity Period
rule_text: Whereas the Parties have entered into a Collective Agreement which shall remain in effect from May 4th, 2025 through April 30, 2029... This Letter of Understanding shall terminate with the expiry of this Collective Agreement...
summary: This Letter of Understanding, which governs the creation of Special Project Needs Agreements (SPNAs), is effective from May 4, 2025, to April 30, 2029.
logical_representation: VALIDATE(CURRENT_DATE >= '2025-05-04' AND CURRENT_DATE <= '2029-04-30')

expected_outcome.condition: The LOU rules are only applicable between May 4, 2025 and April 30, 2029.

reasoning: This rule establishes the effective date range for the entire Letter of Understanding. It is a fundamental condition-based rule that gates the applicability of all other rules within this document. It is categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it controls the master switch for rules that determine time bucketing.

name: SPNA Template A for Remote Projects
rule_text: If the project gate is beyond daily commuting distance (beyond 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary or Edmonton) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template A.
summary: For projects located more than 125 km from the city center of Calgary or Edmonton, the specific set of rules defined in 'SPNA Template A' must be applied.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) is > 125km from Calgary_Centre OR project_location (Unsupported) is > 125km from Edmonton_Centre -> APPLY_AGREEMENT('SPNA_Template_A')

expected_outcome.condition: A specific ruleset (Template A) is applied to the project, overriding the base collective agreement.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that acts as a high-level switch, determining which entire set of labor rules (SPNA Template A) applies to a project based on its geographic location. It's classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as its ultimate purpose is to select the correct time bucketing logic.

name: SPNA Template B for Local Projects
rule_text: If the project gate is within daily commuting distance (within 125 km of the city centre of either Calgary, or Edmonton or within 45 km of the city centre of Red Deer) the SPNA for the project shall be in the form attached as Template B.
summary: For projects located within 125 km of Calgary or Edmonton city centers, or within 45 km of Red Deer city center, the specific set of rules defined in 'SPNA Template B' must be applied.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) is <= 125km from Calgary_Centre OR project_location (Unsupported) is <= 125km from Edmonton_Centre) OR project_location (Unsupported) is <= 45km from Red_Deer_Centre -> APPLY_AGREEMENT('SPNA_Template_B')

expected_outcome.condition: A specific ruleset (Template B) is applied to the project, overriding the base collective agreement.

reasoning: This is a condition-based rule that acts as a high-level switch, determining which entire set of labor rules (SPNA Template B) applies to a project based on its geographic location. It's classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as its ultimate purpose is to select the correct time bucketing logic.

name: SPNA Continuity After LOU Expiry
rule_text: provided, however, that any SPNA established under this Letter of Understanding shall continue for the term provided therein.
summary: Any Special Project Needs Agreement (SPNA) created under this Letter of Understanding will remain in effect for its own specified term, even if the parent Letter of Understanding expires on April 30, 2029.
logical_representation: IF spna_is_active (llm) == true AND CURRENT_DATE > '2029-04-30' -> OVERRIDE('LOU Validity Period')

expected_outcome.condition: An existing SPNA's rules continue to apply past the LOU's expiration date of April 30, 2029.

reasoning: This is an exception_override rule because it explicitly carves out an exception to the LOU's termination date for pre-existing SPNAs. It overrides the general validity period under specific conditions, ensuring SPNA rules persist beyond the life of the LOU that created them.
